sen.j: 安福殿（あんぷくでん）とは、平安京の内裏における殿舎のひとつ。
sen.e: Anpukuden Hall is one of buildings in dairi (Imperial Palace) of Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto).
Anpukuden Hall was one of the halls of the dairi (Imperial Palace) in the city of Heian-kyo.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに翻訳し直し
sen.e: Anpukuden Hall was one of the halls of the dairi (Imperial Palace) in the city of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 紫宸殿の西南、月華門を挟んで校書殿の南に位置する。
sen.e: It is located in the southwest of Shishin-den Hall (hall for state ceremonies), and is in the south of Kyoshoden Hall (Palace Archives) which is located beyond Gekka-mon Gate.
Situated in the southeast of the Imperial Palace, this hall was located to the south of Kyoshoden Hall (Palace Archive Hall) beyond Gekka-mon Gate.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: Situated in the southeast of the Imperial Palace, this hall was located to the south of Kyoshoden Hall (Palace Archive Hall) beyond Gekka-mon Gate.

sen.j: 南庭東側の春興殿とは東西に相対する。
sen.e: It is the opposite side of Shunkyo-den (a part of Heiankyo Palace) which is located on the east side of the southern country yard.
It stood opposite Shunkyoden which was situated on the eastern side of the south garden.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように翻訳し直し
sen.e: It stood opposite Shunkyoden, which was situated on the eastern side of the south garden, facing in an east-west direction.

sen.j: 侍医や薬生（やくしょう）が控えていたので薬殿（くすどの）とも。
sen.e: It was also called as the Kusudono (Physician's Hall) as jii (a doctor for the Emperor and the Imperial family) or Medical students stayed in there.
It was also called Kusudono (Physician's Hall) because court physicians and medical students resided there.
sen.cmt: ナチュラルに翻訳し直し
sen.e: It was also called Kusudono (Physician's Hall) because court physicians and medical students resided there.
